Quinn is in the same boat as Corki and Graves, both of which are considered separate entities from normal ADC's. This is because Quinn was reworked with the idea of being played mid instead of bot; the fact that she plays top instead is irrelevant. 

As far as a small pick rate, the only thing I feel like that should be taken into account for is the general feeling of people who actually *play* bot lane. If they're currently only picking the only marksmen that are good and feel rewarding to play instead of picking the five or so mages that are destroying the lane, that's a clear sign that what people who actually play botlane want to play *is* marksmen and should be taken more into account than what people who play mid, top and jungle have to say. Play rate means zero in the face of the fact that I'm an ADC main; I want to play ADC's. If I had wanted, at any point during the time I played league, to play a mage/bruiser/tank/assassin, I would have gone out of bot lane and went to play mid/top/jungle. But I didn't do that; I stayed playing *botlane* on *ADCs*. Because that's what *I* want to play. Nerfing everything I want to play to try and give me diversity that I, honestly, already had isn't going to make me suddenly play mages/bruisers/tanks/assassins. Its just going to piss me off and make me feel like I'm not privy to this game.

And finally, sure, OP.GG listed this picks as being "top tier" but at the same time, many of the picks just have high play rates; Ezreal has a *negative winrate* but people still play him because they still just *like to play him.* Kai'sa also has a negative winrate but people still player her because they like to play her; that and she is a very flexible ADC that can play a multitude of builds. Jinx just got buffed but she's still doing less well than Swain or Yasuo; Swain has both a higher pick rate and higher winrate than her while Yasuo's pick and winrate are on equal footing to hers. 

Miss Fortune is the only ADC champion on that "tier list" that I would consider harshly over tuned and its only because she actually *likes* Stormrazor and it synergizes very well with the rest of her bursty build.

My point is that just because the champions are picked more often or not does not mean that they are good. They are just the champions that people who play bot lane *actually* want to play and this forced diversity is actually just restricting the people who play bot lane more than ever.

No champion who had a negative win rate was nerfed for their performance in solo queue. Champions that were too prevalent in pro play, yes, garnered nerfs and a handful of the ones you mentioned literally fall under that umbrella. Specifically:

Lee Sin, Azir, Elise, and *maybe* Jinx though she was popular in season 5 when I was just starting league so my knowledge on that is fuzzy.

A few champions with negative solo queue wr's that did get nerfed despite it that you didn't mention also include Ryze and Galio.

Caitlyn, in my honestly opinion, was unfairly nerfed. She was never broken, she has very clear counter play in that she placed a trap there? Don't step on it. She is also largely immobile and lacks an AS steroid, meaning she doesn't scale as well as other hyper carries; what carries her in the midgame is her range and utility, much like Ashe. She got nerfed because a bunch of people gathered around and circlejerked until Riot said,"Okay fine, whatever. STFU." and gutted her. She had a high play rate but despite that she never, *never* broached pasted a 50% winrate. 

Lucian was *actually* broken in previous seasons and usually gained nerfs because his WR was above 50%. He was never nerfed when he had a negative WR. 

With all of this in mind, Ezreal is not currently broken; he was weakened heavily but further stat nerfs. As a skillshot based ADC he has clear weaknesses in that if he misses his skillshots, his damage is gone. The only thing I personally find frustrating about Ezreal is that his Q hit box is *not* very clear or clean, making it hard to dodge at times, and his E is honestly too short a CD for just *how* good it is. I wouldn't consider him over tuned at present time; just a league favorite, especially of *Korea* where OP.GG takes its stats from.

Also, how the people who actually main a role/lane feel about changes to their role or lane should matter and take precedence over the people who don't. Its like me suddenly deciding that midlane is too diverse and then making changes so that only ADCs can play there, something that has been steadily happening over the last season. I don't play midlane; why should I decide what is actually *played* there? Before patch 8.11, I wouldn't have magically started playing midlane either just because they make the ADC I like playing good there. I could still play them bot. Now if they decided to make changes for ADC's to be good midlane, sure, I'd play them there in a heartbeat because the place I used to play them was made systematically unfriendly toward them.
